arts.ttl: Armenia vs Portugal live stream: Where and how to watch the match?
arts.sum: Portugal takes on Armenia in a live-streamed match this Saturday at 6 PM during the 2026 World Cup qualifiers at the Vazgen Sargsyan Republican Stadium. Four Paris Saint-Germain players are involved in this match, all representing Portugal: Nuno Mendes (23-year-old left back), Vitinha (25-year-old midfielder), João Neves (20-year-old midfielder), and Gonçalo Ramos (24-year-old striker). arts.ttl: Armenia vs Portugal broadcast – Time and channel to watch the match
arts.sum: Portugal takes on Armenia this Saturday at 6:00 PM (French time) in a match that will be broadcast on L’Equipe Live Foot. The game will take place at the Vazgen Sargsyan Republican Stadium as part of the 2026 World Cup qualifying. arts.ttl: Portugal XI vs Armenia – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Portugal begin their 2026 World Cup qualification campaign with a fixture against Armenia at the Vazgen Sargsyan Republican Stadium in Yerevan on Saturday. The Red Lions host the UEFA Nations League winners on home soil as they aim to secure a historic first appearance at a major tournament. arts.ttl: Armenia vs Portugal – Match preview and team news
arts.sum: Portugal host Armenia this weekend in their first FIFA World Cup 2026 qualifier since the tragic passing of Diogo Jota in July. Rúben Neves has inherited the no.21 shirt from the former Liverpool forward and has revealed a tattoo on his left calf in honour of his late friend.
